alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 8:29PM EST until December 28 at 4:30AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg affecting Cherokee and York Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River in South Carolina near Blacksburg. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Action Stage Flooding continues. Minor flooding of low-lying farmland along the river may be ongoing. Areas along Buffalo Creek may begin to flood due to backwater effects. At 15.0 feet, Action Stage Flooding continues. The Broad River may approach River Road and Little Hope Road near US 29. At 16.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. The Broad River may flood River Rd. and Little Hope Rd. near US 29. Farmland flooding continues adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 16.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 07/08/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM EST.
